newsitem.title: USA: CSCE cocoa called to open $10 to $15 a tonne lower.
newsitem.headline: CSCE cocoa called to open $10 to $15 a tonne lower.

text.p: CSCE cocoa futures were called to open $10 to $15 per tonne lower on Wednesday, on the heels of a weak performance in London overnight, traders said.

London cocoa futures drifted lower in thin trade early Wednesday, but LIFFE September managed to hold key chart support at 1,000 stg. At the midday break, September was down 15 stg, to 1,002 stg, after ranging narrowly from 1,008 to 1,001 stg.

Tuesday, New York cocoa futures fell sharply, battered by speculative selling. September ended down $29 per tonne, to $1,510, after ranging between $1,538 and $1,508. Second-month December closed $29 lower, at $1,559, while the back months also slid $29.
Technically, traders said September faced some support in the low $1,490s, followed by $1,485 and $1,475. On the upside, resistance was seen near $1,520, then $1,526-$1,527 and $1,540.
